Package poised

Class ReadAndWriteToFile

java.lang.Object
poised.ReadAndWriteToFile
public abstract class ReadAndWriteToFile extends Object
Abstract class that reads and writes project object information from and to an external database.

A list of Project attribute information is read from PoiseProjects.txt then populated into new Project objects and added to the projectList.

When a new project object is captured, the formatted string object is appended to the text file. Finally, when the program closes the list of project objects is written to the text file and overwrites all data with the newly updated project data.

When a project object is marked as finalised, the string details are appended to CompletedProjects.txt.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Megan Bisschoff

  • Method Details

    • readProjectsFromFile

      public static List<Project> readProjectsFromFile(File projectsFile) throws IOException
      Method reads each line form the text file and splits up the comma seperated values into associated Project fields. New Project and Person objects are initialised and the values are set into the respective Project attributes.

      An array list is inititalised which returns each poiseProjects added to the list.

    • Project number
    • Project name
    • Project type
    • Project addres
    • Project ERF number
    • Fee total
    • Fee paid
    • Project deadline
    • Project finalisation status
    • Customers full name
    • Customers contact number
    • Customers email
    • Customers address
    • Architects full name
    • Architects contact number
    • Architects email
    • Architects address
    • Contractors full name
    • Contractors contact number
    • Contractors email
    • Contractors address
      • Parameters:
      projectsFile - the text file containing the object to be read.
      Returns:
      an arraylist of project objects.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file can't be located and read from

    • writeListToFile

      public static void writeListToFile(File projectsFile, List<Project> projectList)
      Calls the projectString method to obtain the string details of all the projects in the projectList then writes each object to PoiseProjects.txt.
      Parameters:
      projectsFile - the text file to be written to.
      projectList - the list of project objects to be written to file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file could not be located and written.

    • writeProjectToFile

      public static void writeProjectToFile(File projectsFile, Project newProject)
      Calls the projectString method to obtain the string details of a single newly captured project then writes and appends the object details to PoiseProjects.txt.
      Parameters:
      projectsFile - the text file to be written to.
      newProject - the new project object created to be appended to file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file could not be located and written.

    • writeCompletedProjectToFile

      public static void writeCompletedProjectToFile(File completedProjectsFile, Project completedProject)
      Calls the toString method of the specified completed project to obtain the string details then writes and appends the object details to CompletedProjects.txt.
      Parameters:
      completedProjectsFile - the text file to be written to.
      completedProject - the project object set as finalised.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file could not be located and written.
